words.hint: A system of interconnected computers and devices that communicate to share resources and data.
A device connected to a network that can send or receive data.
A basic networking device that connects multiple devices in a network and transmits data to all ports.
A networking device that directs data packets to specific devices within a network.
A device that forwards data between different networks and manages network traffic.
A device that provides wireless connectivity to a wired network.
A unique identifier assigned to a network interface controller for communication within a network.
A numerical label assigned to each device connected to a network for identification and communication.
A method of transmitting data to all devices within a network segment.
A communication method where data is sent from one device to a specific recipient.
A type of network cable used to connect devices in wired networks.
A high-speed transmission medium that uses light to carry data over long distances.
A wireless networking technology that allows devices to connect to the internet or a local network.
A short-range wireless technology for connecting devices.
A type of network cable consisting of pairs of twisted wires to reduce interference.
An event where two devices transmit data simultaneously on the same network segment, causing interference.
A switch's internal table that maps MAC addresses to specific ports.
A structured unit of data transmission in a network.
The arrangement of different network elements and their connections.
A value in data packets that limits their lifespan in a network.
A protocol used to map IP addresses to MAC addresses.
The fourth version of the Internet Protocol, using 32-bit addresses.
A numerical mask used to divide an IP address into network and host parts.
A method for allocating IP addresses and managing routing.
An IP address used within private networks, not routable on the internet.
An IP address that is unique across the internet.
An IP address used to test network applications locally.
A server that dynamically assigns IP addresses to devices on a network.
A server that translates domain names into IP addresses.
The process of adding headers and footers to data for network transmission.
